item.title: Zoom
item.description: TLDR: For technical (and political) discussions: async communication > sync communication After reading this post on Hacker News yesterday I agreed mostly to the post, then I read the comments. Many people seem not to agree. I feel much more confident in async communication, when discussing technical problems (or political discussions). Maybe it is because I am not so good at giving good speedy answers. Often I find good answers after the conversation has ended (same with jokes, L’esprit de l’escalier or in German: Treppenwitz (staircase wit)).

item.title: Conductors
item.description: I don’t know much about orchestra and conducting, however I sang in a boy’s choir when I was a child and since then I have admiration for orchestras and I like classical music. This is Georges Prêtre conducting the Vienna New Year’s Concert in 2010. I like how he is enjoying the music and sometimes is not conducting at all but only listening. Then, watch the end, Prêtre being 85 years old, he can still explode!
